content: The "Business Checking Freedom Act of 2003" allows all businesses to have interest-bearing transaction accounts. The amendment to Public Law 93-100 allows depositors to make up to 24 transfers per month between accounts in the same institution for any purpose. SEC. 3. PAYMENT OF INTEREST ON RESERVES AT FEDERAL RESERVE BANKS. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to allow depository institutions to earn interest on balances maintained at a Federal Reserve bank, with earnings paid quarterly at rates not exceeding short-term interest rates. The Board may regulate the payment and distribution of these earnings to the institutions. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to allow depository institutions to earn interest on balances maintained at a Federal Reserve bank, with earnings paid quarterly at rates not exceeding short-term interest rates. The distribution of earnings to depository institutions and their responsibilities, along with the definition of depository institutions, are outlined. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to allow depository institutions to earn interest on balances held at a Federal Reserve bank. The definition of depository institutions is expanded to include various entities. Additionally, technical and conforming amendments are made to the Act. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to allow depository institutions to earn interest on balances held at a Federal Reserve bank. Section 19 of the Act is also amended for technical and conforming changes. SEC. 4 amends the Federal Reserve Act to give the Federal Reserve Board more flexibility in setting reserve requirements. The ratio can now be not greater than 3 percent (including zero) and not less than zero. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to allow additional transfers from surplus funds to cover interest payments for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to allow transfers from surplus funds to cover interest payments for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. The Federal Reserve Board will determine the amount each bank must pay during this period, and no bank can replenish its surplus fund with transferred amounts. Additionally, a technical and conforming amendment is made to Section 7(a) of the Federal Reserve Act. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to transfer excess funds from Federal Reserve banks to the Treasury during fiscal years 2003 through 2007.
